segments.text: I see the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it's the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's so focused on getting those cookies, he doesn't even notice how wobbly that stool is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think he's going to fall any second now, and it makes me nervous just watching him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it's about to tip over, and he's just standing there, precariously balanced.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl standing nearby, waiting for her share of the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems to be cheering him on, not realizing the danger he's in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how reckless he's being, all for a few cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think he's going to regret this if he ends up falling and hurting himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water on the floor makes it even more dangerous, and he doesn't even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will notice what's happening before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a disaster waiting to happen, and no one seems to be aware of it.
segments.speaker: PAR
